text.note: Mitchell Library, Harpur MS A87-2, p.699
This fragment reappears in modified form in A97.
text.l: I saw again the trains that round my car
Swift blazingStreamed countless, as I rolled in state through Egypt!
I saw the wondrous beauty of my youth
As it strode riding,smiling, through the courts of Ptolomy!
With them who there adored it! Saw again
The pomps & pageantrypageantry that once round me beamed
Unparagoned brightness. And, in seeing, felt
TheAgain the temper and the taste of all
The godlike loftiness of such a lifeâ€”
text.note: This fragment reappears in in A97.
text.l: DownThen flashed on meas well the lightnings of a wrath
